main event: A bright, star-like explosion was sighted by the crew of an Air Force B-54 Bomber, with visual and radar contacts made.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on 15 January 1954, and lasted approximately 9 minutes., Two objects were picked up on radar during the sighting., The objects were described as bright, blue-white and the size of a matchhead., The observed object emitted an instantaneous flash and was characterized as a meteor or short duration radar contacts., An observer noted one object appeared circular, grayish, and revolving, radiating a greenish charge.
sighted object: bright, star-like explosion and circular grayish object
witness description: crew members of an Air Force B-54 Bomber
